title: What is your go-to-song to lift your spirits? - Quora

response.answer_text: Whenever I am down I listen to "What a wonderful world" by Louis Armstrong (musician). Despite all that is horribly wrong with the world today, this songs helps put things in perspective. There are a lot fucked up today but then again, there's a lot that is good and beautiful.   The colors of the rainbow so pretty in the skyAre also on the faces of people going byI see friends shaking handsSaying, "How do you do?"They're really saying, "I love you."   And then there is Somewhere Over the Rainbow by Israel "IZ" Kamakawiwo'ole.    Other songs that never fail to cheer me up are: Iris (Goo Goo Dolls): I first fell in love with this track in the movie "City of Angels".  And then there is this live version where it started to rain during the concert.  Your hand in mine (Explosions in the Sky): The band that got me into post-rock, EitS has an ethereal sound and they manage to touch every point on the emotional spectrum during the course of a song. Which is even more impressive, considering that there are no lyrics. Fast car (Tracy Chapman): A song about moving away, to a new place, a new life. Hey ya! (Outkast; cover by The Blanks): Scrubs is my favorite TV series and this cover by The Blanks (aka Ted's Band) really nailed it. Kyun (Barfi!): The song's about insouciance, about saying yes to every adventure, and embarking on the journey called life. Phir le aaya dil (Barfi) Fix you (Coldplay): There is something reassuring when someone says that they "will be there to fix you". Hotel California (Eagles): One of the greatest songs ever written, no one really knows for sure what the song signifies. But you can clearly see the imagery - a dark night, a desert highway, an inn in the middle of nowhere.  Mr Tambourine Man (Bob Dylan): Hey ! Mr Tambourine Man, play a song for me I'm not sleepy and there is no place I'm going to Hey ! Mr Tambourine Man, play a song for me In the jingle jangle morning I'll come followin' you. Or anything by Death Cab for Cutie (Transatlanticism - full album (seamlessly looped)

If you’re in a bad mood, what you probably need is a distraction to lift your spirits or a way to overcome the reason for your bad mood. 1 If I’m feeling down and I don’t know why, I listen to this song “Hawa Hawa Aye Hawa Khusbu Luta De”. This song was released some 20 years ago. It still makes me get up and start dancing. The place doesn’t matter! The steps don’t matter! It cheers me up big time.  2 If I’m feeling down down because of a shock or a surprise, I listen to a song which gives me a good advice and has a good beat to it “Breathe” by Seeb  3 If I’m unsure, or afraid, and I need the ‘20 seconds of insane courage’, I listen to this : “Read All About It” by Emeli Sande  4 If I’m not in a good mood because of some work that I’ve been avoiding or procrastination, I listen to “Baby” by Justin Bieber. This makes me turn off my cellphone/ Walkman, get on my ass and do things!

March To The Sea by Twenty One PilotsCurrently I think this song uplifts my spirit and soul and i just listen to every word sung in this song. It helps me remain calm and you know that one moment while listening any (of your favourite) song when you feel- this is it. This is the moment I never want to end, i feel that with this song :)Twenty One Pilots (often stylized as twenty one pilots or TWENTY ØNE PILØTS) is an American musical duo that originates fromColumbus, Ohio. The band was formed in 2009 by Tyler Joseph along with former members Nick Thomas and Chris Salih, and currently consists of vocalist/keyboardist Tyler Joseph and drummer Josh Dun.(from Wikipedia)Some other songs which you might wanna listen to:-Stressed out by Twenty One Pilotsbasically any song by TOP, their lyrics are so meaningfulFire by Noah GundersonCarry On My Wayward Son by KansasOut of Control by LushMajor Tom by David BowieRiptide/From afar/Mess is mine by Vance JoyAlso, if you ever wanna listen to random songs according to your mood, visit Best app for music (8tracks.com) I swear this is not advertising

Elvis Presley - Burning Love, or Keith Urban - Blue Ain't Your Colour. Keith's song is about a guy in a bar watching a woman being mistreated by her man, Keith is essentially giving her advice when he sees how upset she is. Also listening to the long guitar solo by Eric Clapton in LAY DOWN SALLY takes me to a better place. DON'T BRING ME DOWN - ELO Electric Light Orchestra BOB MARLEY - COULD YOU BE LOVED, SATISFY MY SOUL BERES HAMMOND - THEY GONNA TALK. Its amazing how many people feel blue but get better by helping others which gives them a lift taking their minds of their own problems. music does the same thing in that it really can lift you out of a rut. SOME SONGS HAVE A SAD ELEMENT TO THEM BUT CONTAIN SOLUTIONS. REGGAE MUSIC IS FULL OF SONGS WITH REMEDIES & UPLIFTING POSITIVE MESSAGES THAT TOTALLY PUT ME IN A GOOD ZONE. GOOD LUCK TO YOU.

There are quite a few that do it for me and they're all cheesy pop songs. My taste in music is quite varied but I usually hate pop songs, my favourite bands are Radiohead and Red Hot Chili Peppers, so there's an idea of my taste. So the songs I'm about to mention I would class as guilty pleasures. Please keep this to yourself and please please please don't judge me!! Take That - Never Forget & Back For GoodCarly Rae Jepsom(sp) - Call Me MaybeJason Derulo (when you read his name you MUST sing it!) - TrumpetsMcFly - StargirlRhianna - We Found LoveOne Direction - That's What Makes You BeautifulNoah & the Whale - Five Years Time They all make me smile from ear-to-ear!! There are probably hundreds of other guilty pleasures but that's all I can think of now!! Another favourite, one that I'm not ashamed of (ha!) is Chandelier by Sia. I think it's wonderful and although it doesn't put me in a great mood instantly I find it inspiring. I'm a writer and when I need something emotional for a story or article or scene I listen to Chandelier and immediately know what to write. If you haven't heard any of these, give them a go and then tell me what you think. Or comment with any guilty pleasures you may have!! I'd love to hear them.

Let the waters rise by Mikeschair https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=KIkQ7YVys_this song really makes me feel good every single time I hear it,so it may help you too specially if u're religious types ;) Here's this song's lyrics… Don't know where to begin, it's like my world's cavin' inAnd I try but I can't control my fear, where do I go from here?Sometimes it's so hard to pray when You feel so far awayBut I am willin' to go where You want me to and God I trust You There's a ragin' sea right in front of meWants to pull me in, bring me to my kneesSo let the waters rise if You want them toI will follow You, I will follow You, I will follow You I will swim in the deep 'cause You'll bein' next to meYou're in the eye of the storm and the calm of the seaYou're never out of reachGod, You know where I've been and You were there with me thenYou were faithful before, You'll be faithful again, I'm holdin' Your hand There's a ragin' sea right in front of meWants to pull me in, bring me to my kneesSo let the waters rise if You want them toI will follow You, I will follow You, I will follow You God Your love is enough, You will pull me through, I'm holdin' onto YouGod Your love is enough, I will follow You, I will follow you! these are some other songs… Maybe,hero,somebody's me by enrique iglesias.I’m alive by celina dion.The Call by regina spektor.Khaabon k parindey from the movie zindagi na milegi dobara Khwabon ke parindey full video song zindagi na milegi dobara.aviJeena jeena & kuch is tarah by atif aslamMaula mere le le meMeri jaan:Krishna Beura, Salim MerchantSoch na sake- Airlift movieWo humsafar tha: Qurat-ul-ain balouchZaroori tha Rahat fateh ali khan.Thanks. Hope You'll like these too ;)

A song that most people don't even know has lyrics. I'm pretty grateful to whoever wrote this question because for years I loved this one piano melody they'd play on the radio from time to time, entirely instrumental. Then, one day, I was walking through a store in Germany and heard the song being played with lyrics in the piped music coming in over the speakers. For several years afterwards I asked lots of people who knew music better than me (not hard to do, not my forte) if they knew the lyrics of where I could find them. Everyone said there are no lyrics. I knew better because I'd heard them. Fast forward 30 years, and thanks to the great internet and this question I've finally found them. Here it is, the one song that always instantly puts me in a good mood as an instrumental, and now, finally, also with the lyrics. Music Box Dancer (edit - new video, old video was replaced)  Oh, and I'm not certain, but I think this is the instrumental version that first got me hooked on the song.  One final interesting tidbit, at that time in Germany, 1980, music boxes made with wood from the black forest were extremely popular, especially in the store I was in on that great day when I finally learned that the happy music had words.

Here is the list of a few songs that readily energized me :- Tarkeebein from the movie “ Band Baaja Baarat”Tarkeebein, tarkeebein kitni hai tarkeebeinTarkeebein, tarkeebein apni hai tarkeebeinSatrangi sapne hai, atrangi tarkeebein My favorite lines in this song are :- Hum kal se kal niptenge jo hoga dekh lengeHum tas se mas na honge jo hoga dekh lengeThande pade jo haunsle sek lengeChadhte sooraj ko chhooke sek lengeTension vension kya hai bas maathe pe bal hote hainBeparwah muskaano se yehi masle hal hote hainAazma le aazma le changi hain tarkeebein Someday form the band FlipsydeSomeday we gonna rise up on that wind you know Someday we gonna dance with those lions Someday we gonna break free from these chains and keep on flying SPUN again which is from FlipsydeSee we gotta get it right but we always get it wrong And it be the same old thing and it be the same old song Tryin' to fight to survive Tryin' to fight for our lives See I'm only tryin' to live I don't wanna say goodbye But the day that it all should end Holla back some more that be Cause we'll all be born again Maybe then we'll all be free and the day that it all should stop Is a day that will never come Cause we gonna live forever Spinning until we're spun [Chorus] Here we go one more time here we go one more timeNow we Spinnin' yeah we spinnin' Yeah we spinnin' now we spun Here we go one more time here we go one more time Now we Spinnin' yeah we spinnin' Yeah we spinnin' now we spun

Bruce Springteen: “Dancing in the Dark” because it reminds me of my happy childhood. When I was about 4 years old my dad would turn off all the lights in the house. He would light a couple candles for dramatic effect and so we could see each other laughing and smiling. Then “Dancing in the Dark” would blast at full volume, filling every room in the house. My mom, my little brother, my father and I would start dancing about with glee to the lyrics. Then my dad would take me in me in his arms and throw me up into the air as high as he could and catch me safely, and I would shriek with amusement and giggle uncontrollably. We were terrible dancers, jerking and bopping about like fish on the sand. But it didn't matter in my house. This moment comes over me, every time I hear this track, to this day. My mom tells me that she has he has never seen anyone as smitten and spellbound by love, as my dad was with me around that age. He adored me and would do anything to make me smile. Therefore, “Dancing in the Dark” not only makes me move my feet, but it fills with gratitude that I have been blessed to be raised by such loving and fun parents. I got to recreate the dance at my wedding, and we all smiled just as brightly.  Picture of me hugging my dad super tight at my wedding.

A2A. Thanks. The following songs are ones I’d run a marathon to, or probably play during a round of Counter Strike, or while working out, or while I Boss Fight someone irl, or something else that might require some extra effort. They’re pure energy. A few of them might get heavy, most of them will, so discretion is advised. But be brave and check em all out: Lamb of God - 11th Hour: 12 Stones - Anthem for The Underdog: Faith No More - Be Aggressive: Meshuggah - Bleed: Trivium - Blind Leading The Blind: Bhayanak Maut - Boiled. Unwound. Filatured.: Arch Enemy - Breaking The Law (Judas Priest Cover): Korn - Clown: Mastodon - Creature Lives: Karnivool - Deadman: Mudvayne - Fucking Determined: Monuments - I, The Creator: Machine Head - Imperium: Nirvana - Lithium: Alter Bridge - Metalingus: Alice In Chains - No Excuses: Gojira - Oroborus: Tool - The Patient: Red Fang - Prehistoric Dog: Bhayanak Maut - Ranti Nasha: Meshuggah - Rational Gaze: Karnivool - Themata: Dragonforce - Through The Fire And Flames: Alter Bridge - Ties That Bind: Rise Against - Under The Knife: Bullet For My Valentine - Waking The Demon: Our Lady Peace - Whatever: Alter Bridge - White Knuckles: TV On The Radio - Wolf Like Me: I feel bad for not including Rage Against The Machine at all, but most of their songs get me pumped up, I couldn’t have listed all of them anyway. There’s definitely a buttload of artists I haven’t mentioned here (due to various constraints).

Coldplay. I listen to their songs whenever I am feeling a bit under the weather. And they never fail to bring a smile to my face. My favorites are- 1. Viva La Vida  2. Paradise  3. Yellow  4. The Scientist  5. Charlie Brown  6.Every Teardrop is a Waterfall  Apart from Coldplay, other songs that lift me up are - 1. Counting Stars - One Republic  2. Demons - Imagine Dragons  3. Shut Up and Dance - Walk the Moon  4. Best Day of My Life - American Authors

There are a wide variety of songs for different moods, but these are a few which will always make you feel optimistic and energised, thereby making you feel good. The list follows in no particular order. Suggestion: Play the video along the song. :) 1. Don't You Worry Child ft. John Martin by Swedish House Mafia.     2. Wake Me Up - Avicii.   3. Hakuna Matata - The Lion King.   4. Just the way you are - Bruno Mars   5. Counting Stars - One Republic.   6. Demons - Imagine Dragons (Personal Favorite)    7. Game of Thrones OST - Ramin Djawadi   8. F.R.I.E.N.D.S - The Rembrandts    9.  No Time For Caution (Interstellar) - Hans Zimmer    10. Strobe - deadmau5   SPECIAL MENTION : Breathless and Breathless (Reprise) - Shankar Mahadevan

Since I don't listen to much popular music, my answer will not only date me, it will expose me to widespread contempt on many fronts. The song is Bobby McFerrin's "Don't Worry, Be Happy," and my response to it is not based on the lyrics (called "simplistic" and "delusional") but on the quality of its musical invention. For me, it not only induces a feeling of well-being the way some Mozart pieces do, but it delights my mind in tracking the subtleties of the vocal line and the creation of the accompaniment entirely from body percussion. I don't hear it often, but when I do come across it, I am always delighted. And now I'm going to depart the halls of Quora for a little while so that the hail can fall where it will. I'm going to have a cocktail, and maybe even listen to a certain #1 song.

“Never Too Far Gone” by Jordan Feliz. The lyrics are supposed to be God, speaking to His beloved child. The words resonate with my spirit, because so many times in my walk with Christ, I've felt that I've indeed, “been too far gone" when I've drifted from Him. Or that I don't deserve His love and acceptance. But when reading His word and praying, He always reassures me that I'm not ever too far away that He can't reach me. That even though I fail Him everyday, His love for me will never stop! Hell never take it away! He forgives me all day long, and will love me forever! The song reminds of how deep His love is for His children really is. Ive included the lyrics below, so take a look at them and see if you've ever felt that way, or thought those thoughts. I know I have from time to time--and the Holy Spirit never fails to lead me back. All praise, honor and glory to you Father!  “I have loved you from the startI have seen your hurting heart And you feel so lonely, but you keep on hiding'Cause you feel so guilty for what you've done, butThere's no distance too far, that I can't reach youThere's no place that's so dark, that I can't find youAnywhere that you are, if you need proofTake a look at these scars, and know I love youDoesn't matter, doesn't matter, doesn't matter what you've doneYou are never, you are never, never too far gone ====== You have run down every roadAnd you've lost your way back home And you feel so dirty you know you're unworthyFeeling undeserving of any love, butThere's no distance too far, that I can't reach youThere's no place that's so dark, that I can't find youAnywhere that you are, if you need proofTake a look at these scars, and know I love youDoesn't matter, doesn't matter, doesn't matter what you've doneYou are never, you are never, never too far gone You will never outrun my love, my love, my loveYou will never outrun my love, my love, my love”

Hard to handle by The Black Crowes  Baby here I amI'm the man on the sceneI can give you what you wantBut you gotta' come home with me I have got some good old lovin'And I got some more in storeWhen I get through throwin' it onYouYou gotta' come back for more [Chorus]Boys and things that come by theDozenThat ain't nothin' but drugstoreLovin'Hey little thing let me light yourCandle'Cause mama I'm sure hard to handle nowGets around Action speaks louder than wordsAnd I'm a man of great experienceI know you've got another manBut I can love you better than him Take my hand don't be afraidI'm gonna prove every word I sayI'm advertising love for freeSo you can place your ad with me Boys come along a dime by the dozenThat ain't nothing but ten centLovin'Pretty little thing let me light yourCandle'Cause mama I'm sure hard to handle nowYes I am Baby here I amI'm the man on the sceneI can give you what you wantBut you gotta' come home with me [Chorus]

There are plenty. But I'll go with a less obscure one.  Pachelbel's Canon in D Major.   I don't know necessarily what constitutes a good mood. But this is one song that seems to ease the tension, quell the anger, and make me breathe easy again. This, my favorite rendition, is especially magical. For a song of such serene simplicity, it feels like it has infinite levels of power. It embodies dreams, memories, love, and loss. It's an experience. The human experience. It has life all wrapped up in it. The good, the bad, the past, the future. It's truly humbling. It makes me feel like my troubles are but a passing eddy in an ever flowing river.

Not a single song. But these 3 are the ones that pop into my mind. 1. Khwabo ke Parindey (Zindagi na Milegi Dobara).  The movie in itself is a feel good one. The song tops it off, putting me in a way better mood than before. 2. Meethi Boliyan (Kai Po Che)  It's a song in regards to the friendship between 3 brothers and just how they've been at the top of this bond. 3. Jugni (Queen)  The track is mostly about a woman discovering herself in a country, where she is on the honeymoon, but on it's own because of her soon-to-be-husband phoning off the wedding during the last minute.

Lots of great songs mentioned already. But how about Beethoven's Ninth?  It's really hard to listen to the Ode to Joy and not be moved. At least, it is for me. Lots of more modern music does it for me, too, but I just thought I'd throw in a vote for Ludwig.

In my opinion, there are wide variation of lift-the-spirits. Sometimes when i feel kinda bored, i listen to some heavy metal (Cigaro by SOAD, or Awaken by Deathklok) to lift up things. But it's different when i get writer's block (it's awful especially if you are an architect in need of ideas), i usually listen to fast paced jazz (like Moaning by Charles Mingus) or classical music (Hall of The Mountain Kings or Overture kinda do the work). But when i'm working, in order to maintain my focus, i like to listen to slow paced classic, folk song, or blues (House of Rising Sun - The Animals or Times They're A-changing by Bob Dylan). If what i feel is in need of escape, all i want to listen to is pop songs or rock or alternative (songs from Grouplove, Peach Pit, Varsity) or sometimes songs from Cage the Elephant, especially the ones from Unpeeled Ps: I'm so sorry if I put the genre wrong, because i dont have a particular genre to listen to and usually i can't differentiate genres like death metal or heavy metal. Again, sorry hehe

Not a single song. But these 3 are the ones that pop into my mind. 1. Khwabo ke Parindey (Zindagi na Milegi Dobara).   The movie in itself is a feel good one. The song  tops it off, putting me in a way better mood than before. 2. Meethi Boliyan (Kai Po Che)  It's a song about the friendship between 3 brothers and how they are high on this bond. 3. Jugni (Queen)  The song is about a girl discovering herself in a new country, where she is on her honeymoon, but all alone due to her soon-to-be-husband calling off the wedding at the last moment.

If it has to be the one song that instantly puts me in good mood,I feel it is "yun hi chala chal raahi" from the movie  Swadesh. This song is composed by A.R Rehman and the lyrics is beautiful,liberating one from the stress of daily work.Javed akhtar as a lyricist has put the philosophy of life in simple but insightful words. Its a song about journey of life and what makes a person happy.  Jeevan mai preet hai , hoton pe geet hai bas yeh hi jeet hai , sun le rahi   Another song worth mentioning is  Lazarus by procupine tree. Steven wilson's voice and music are soothing. The song is about hope. To me, it sounds like a "personal resurrection" just like lazarus.

There are a lot of songs that uplift my spirit. However, I'll just pick two favorites. 5 O’ Clock World - The Vogues The Vogues Five O'Clock World Stereo Remastered HQ Version (use 480p) Great song that never fails to bring a smile to my face. It's just so light and fun! Alive Again - Chicago Chicago Alive Again I always play this track before cross country meets and tennis matches. It always gets me in the mood to go out and compete! Though there are many songs I could put on this list, those are two of my favorites!

The Court And Spark album by Joni Mitchell fills me with delight every time I listen to it. It’s just so full of joy. It’s got a floating, jazzy feel, like her album Hissing Of Summer Lawns. The lyrics are fantastic. The singing is superb and the band’s playing is totally mesmerising, it’s just that good. The album is about the delight of finding new love. If I had to go for one song off the album I’d choose A Free Man In Paris which she wrote about music label owner David Geffen. The track epitomises the light, jazzy feel of the album.

Stevie Wonder seems to me one of the most joyous human beings on the planet (along with being among its greatest composers and performers), and the song he wrote on the occasion of his daughter's birth never fails to fill my heart with happiness. Stevie wanted to keep "Isn't She Lovely" as a private tribute to his daughter and wife, but friends pressured him to release it because they knew how much joy it would bring to the world. And every time I need a song to help me celebrate a little, I thank them for that.

I didn’t look at all the answers, but I’d like to guess that mine might be the odd one out of everyone’s answers. This is the song I’m thinking about:  It’s Erebus by Aversions Crown. It’s a brutal deathcore song with crazy high screams, pretty good lows, and lyrics that are utterly disgusting at time; and I love it. I was addicted to this song for a good week after it’s release, and I’d gladly listen to it again. And again. And again! It’s a good pick me up when I need it.

I don't know about "instantly in a good mood" but there is one song that somehow has insinuated itself into me in such a way that it operates like a switch. No matter how stressed, angry, upset, anxious or depressed I might be at a given point in time, if this song comes on, a switch is thrown in me that chills me out and lets me relax. The song is called "In the Waiting Line" by Zero 7.  Something about this song 'resets' my inner emotional mixture and puts me in a state of mind as if it's a Sunday afternoon, with a light rain outside, nowhere to be, no deadlines to worry about... everything's ok with the world in this moment.

I have a lot of songs that I use when my mood is love, disco, rock, up beat songs. Everything that gets me want to dance alone on the living room floor. But the one that always get my mood rising is a song that a lot of people dislike. This song gets me always smile and feel better. This song is often mentioned as a “guilty pleasure” song. I love guilty pleasures! It’s a pleasure to not be like all other people in this world. Here it is..

Thank you for the A2A Akshay Kumar G. So here goes: Song for Zula - Phosphorescent  Lyrics: Some say love is a burning thing That it makes a fiery ring Oh but I know love as a fading thing Just as fickle as a feather in a stream See, honey, I saw love. You see, it came to me It put its face up to my face so I could see Yeah then I saw love disfigure me Into something I am not recognizing See, the cage, it called. I said, "Come on in" I will not open myself up this way again Nor lay my face to the soil, nor my teeth to the sand I will not lay like this for days now upon end You will not see me fall, nor see me struggle to stand To be acknowledged by some touch from his gnarled hands You see, the cage, it called. I said, "Come on in" I will not open myself up this way again You see, the moon is bright in that treetop night I see the shadows that we cast in the cold, clean light My feet are gold. My heart is white And we race out on the desert plains all night See, honey, I am not some broken thing I do not lay here in the dark waiting for thee No my heart is gold. My feet are light And I am racing out on the desert plains all night So some say love is a burning thing That it makes a fiery ring Oh but I know love as a caging thing Just a killer come to call from some awful dream O and all you folks, you come to see You just stand there in the glass looking at me But my heart is wild. And my bones are steam And I could kill you with my bare hands if I was free﻿.

If you love listening to Trance music, then, I know one such amazing song, by the very well-known, 7 times consistently awarded as a no. 1 DJ among the top 100 DJs, by DJ Mags. He is none other than Armin van Buuren. And the song's name is This Is What It Feels Like. I had listened to this song, once when I was feeling low. This song instantly put me back to good mood. And I was back to my work within no time. Here's the link to its YouTube video:  I hope you enjoy this song. :) PS: Listen to this song with your headphones/earphones on, and a good enough volume, so that you'll completely get to feel the magic behind its refreshing music. :)

Hi there, First off, Sorry to keep pasting this same list of tracks across 2–3 similar questions on the same topic, but since no one is merging questions. i have to do this….. I know you asked only for one song, but im too tempted post them all so…. I’m guaranteeing that these songs, no matter what time of day, are bound to make you smile. IF these have a positive impact on your life, do share the same with people who need to smile . Hungry like the Wolf-Duran Duran  I have no idea why. Ever since I was a kid and I heard this song on Mix 100 I decided it was my favorite for that time period. It has to be Little Wonders by Rob Thomas. It's very soothing, and faith-restoring. The lyrics are beautiful as well.  "Our lives are madeIn these small hoursThese little wonders,These twists & turns of fateTime falls away,But these small hours,These small hours still remain"

Hi Graham, I have several (this is my working playlist, by the way): Another Day of Sun, La La LandTwitch, Jamie Berry (Original Mix)Delight, Jamie BerryOld Records, Jamie BerryLooking Like Me, Lyre Le TempsDramophone / Comics / Mighty, Caravan PalaceThe Sun, Parov StelarAnd by this point I’m usually grooving hard enough to forget about problems.

Whenever I feel low, I listen to "Kun Faya Kun (Be, & it is!)" by  AR Rahman. It helps me to live, love myself more than anything in this world. It makes me feel alive. "Jab kahin pe kuch nahi bhi nahi tha, Wahi tha, Wahi tha, Wahi tha, Wahi tha" (English Translation- When, there was nothing,He was the one,the only one.) Tera Hi Main Ek Saaya, Tune Mujhko Banaya, Main Toh Jag Ko Na Bhaaya, Tune Gale Se Lagaya Ab Tu Hi Hai Khudaya, Sach Tu Hi Hai Khudaya (English Translation- I am your shadow.You have created me.I didn’t fit in the world.Yet you embraced me.Only you are the Just,Only you are the Truth.)

Friends : “ I’ll be there for you” As soon as I hear the word “No one told you” , no matter how bad my day went and how sad I am , I can’t help myself singing with those lines which reminds me all the good memories I have while watching this show and it reminds me that I mgiht be going through a lot but there will be always be someone who will come to you and say these words … “I’ll be there for you” :)

If I'm looking for something to kinda get me going, it's hard to beat some of the more rocking 50's songs I Chuck Barry or the like. If I want to just relax and go on a musical journey, I'd pick an album with lots of musical changes like Moody Blues, Yes, Tull, King Crimson or Pink Floyd. Usually on vinyl. Then I sit back and just lit it pass through me.

Not Afraid (Eminem)Somewhere i Belong ( Linkin Park)Crawling (Linkin Park)Breaking the Habit (Linkin Park)Mockingbird (Eminem)From the Inside (Linkin Park)Battle of Symphony (Linkin Park)Until it’s gone (Linkin Park)Leave out all the rest (Linkin Park)Phenomenal (Eminem)Lose Yourself (Eminem)Wavin Flag ( Knaan 2010 FIFA world cup official song)We own it (Fast and Furious 6)Rest of my Life (Fast and Furious 7)Jeetne ke liye (Azhar)Jeena kya Jeevan se haar ke (Om Jai Jagdish)Jai Ho (Slumdog Millionaire)Chak De IndiaChak Lein De (Chandni Chowk To China)Rabbit Run (Eminem)Extreme Ways (Jason Bourne)Dil Ibaadat (Tum mile)Kya Khoya (Khamoshiyaan)Ali Maula (Kurbaan)There tend to be numerous tracks which constantly lifts me up however these are my all time preferred.

This might sound strange, but I like to listen to metal music to elevate my spirit. This genre usually has a bad reputation, but it is all based on mostly untrue stereotypes. The music is energetic, passionate and if you read the lyrics, super deep and meaningful. This type of music motivates me and gives me energy. Contrary to belief, it is not angry or depressing music (some of it can be, but not all). You can hear the music has soul and the artist has suffered and music is best when it is authentic enough for others to relate to it and feel the emotions. Besides this if I need energy in the mornings or when exercising, I listen to Hardstyle EDM music. The fast paced beats increase my heart rate, gives me energy and the inspiring lyrics makes me feel happy.

It's a “fuck you” kind of song. Reminds me to remember, not to worry what other people think about me, 1. I'll never know what they're thinking, 2. Not to think too much about it, why waste my life worrying about something I can't change. And 3. People suck, just sit down, shut up, grab a drink Look alive, stay alive by Highly Suspect.

The Fighter by Gym Class Heroes- makes me feel like I can achieve anything on days that I feel like everything's bringing me down. Chainbreaker by Zack Williams- when I feel overwhelmed by my circumstances. I Point to You by We Are Messengers- when I can't stop thinking about the stupid stuff I've done in my past. Hope these songs help you like they helped me.

I listen to Bohemian Rhapsody. For some reason, the eclectic music lifts up my spirit. Also, it took me some time to understand the meaning of the song. So every time I listen to it, I keep thinking of the time when I had that revelation. More than lifting up the spirit, it takes away your mind from whatever is causing you stress.

I don't listen to music much and my taste is hardly anything to boast about but I play this song at least four times whenever it hits my playlist. If you want to be happy.. Watch    I have an outdated blog with my list of upbeat songs. You may care to visit that.http://whatremacha.blogspot.in/2011/11/top-25-happy-upbeatfeel-good-songs.html?m=1

‘Galti se mistake’ is one song that instantly brightens my mood instantly nowadays. The lyrics are so Catchy and amazing that they literally makes me do some weird dance .it wake ups that naughty innocent child inside me who just want to have fun and chill out. Plus ranbir adds up to the whole song with his amazing performance in the video. Thug life!!

Here Comes The Sun by The Beatles. I love this song not just for the happy nuances, but for the simple message of hope itself.  When I am in a good mood, this song makes that good mood even better. When I am in a terrible mood, this song reminds me that better times will come ahead and makes me feel better ("I feel the ice is slowly melting").

Music is everything. It needn’t even have any lyrics to lift your spirits. If you listen to some classical pieces from Grieg, Chopin, Albeniz, Ravel, Dvorak, Schumann, Berlioz, Chopin, Mendelssohn, Saint-Saens (few to list), you could go on a very different mental status. When I need to get my work done ASAP, I listen to Iron Maiden. When i need to calm myself down/ have some peaceful time, I listen to Iron and wine, Patrick Watson, Message to the bears and many more. Well, we have Pink Floyd and few from Dream Theater and Opeth for you-know-what ;)

Depend upon why ur spirits are low. Although Eminem’s songs are pretty much Ok for all situations. Songs like Lose Yourself, Not afraid, Till I Collapse can heal u, or at least help u overcome ur dispair. Hymn for the sunday, Numb, We made it happen, Call me personally A Spaceman, these will even make u fell lighter. Also, often it's okay to hear some slow motion tracks, and let the thoughts flow from urself, romantic tracks are very of use after that. Hey Jude, Can’t Assistance Falling In Love, Photograph, like myself Like U Do, these tracks might work also. Sleep depends upon state of mind.

For me, This song encourages to live up to the spirits and all... Safarnama from 'Tamasha'... This song  basically appears when the protagonist (Ranbir) finds the true himself among the mediocre. He actually comes to know at what he should be upto, in life... This song is so beautifully scened among the tribes and locals of shimla...  ​Whenever i listen to this song,I just close my eyes and feel the magic of finding within myself

The song is "Weightless" by English29 ambient music band, Marconi Union. The song contains a sustaining rhythm that starts at 60 beats per minute and gradually slows to around 50. While listening, your heart rate gradually comes to match that beat," in a phenomenon called "entrainment." This reduction in heart rate leads to a reduction in blood pressure. Does this song relax you?

I can practically guarantee that “Peaches en Regalia” by Frank Zappa will put a smile on my face, even though it's not strictly a song. Oddly, thinking about that has triggered an earworm of “Nirvana for Mice” by Henry Cow (probably their only “jolly” tune) which bears some similarity….

There are a wide variety of songs for different moods, but these songs will always make me feel optimistic and energised, thereby making me feel good. These songs are my all-time favorite. Beatles - YesterdayBob Dylan - Blowin' in the windColdplay - ScientistColdplay - YellowColdplay - Fix youLinkin Park - Waiting for the EndEminem - BeautifulLinkin Park - IridescentLinkin Park - Burning in the skyColdplay- MiraclesColdplay - Sky full of StarsLinkin Park - Shadow of the dayEminem - I'm not afraidEminem - Lose yourselfEd sheeran - PhotographExplosion in the sky - Your hand in Mine (instrumental)

Rozalina, Celtic music (particularly Celtic Woman), Native American Drum & Flute, Country Western, and Classic (60s &70s) Rock elevates my spirit depending on my mood. The music activates the 20 year old soul in my Senior Citizen body. I like to float over the countryside to the notes of the music. May you find your own love, joy, and peace through the shortest route.

I'm a huge Eminem fan, and whenever I feel down, i listen to ‘beautiful pain’ by eminem Ft. Sia. It is on one the most motivational songs ive ever heard, and it really helps you to go through and move on! As a matter of fact most of the eminem song will do, some of them are lose yourself, and till I collapse, but for sure for me ‘beautiful pain’ tops it all!

Depend upon why ur spirits are low. Although Eminem’s songs are pretty much Ok for all situations. Songs like Lose Yourself, Not afraid, Till I Collapse can heal u, or at least help u overcome ur dispair. Hymn of The Weekend, Numb, We Did It, Call Me A Spaceman, these will also make u fell lighter. Also, sometimes it’s ok to listen to some slow motion songs, and let the feelings flow out of urself, romantic songs are quite useful then. Hey Jude, Can’t Help Falling In Love, Photograph, Love Me Like U Do, these songs might work too. Rest depends on mood.

I always feel good after hearing “Feeling Stronger Everyday" by Chicago. It starts out slow and builds up as it goes. The lyrics are positive and they are about love. Song speeds up and ends with a frenzy of drums and horns, with Cetera ‘ s great vocals.
